question: 一貫
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>One</kanji> <kanji>sushi counter</kanji> is counting <vocabulary>one piece of sushi</vocabulary>. This can also mean <vocabulary>consistency</vocabulary>, which makes sense if you think about piece of sushi—each one should be as consistent as the last! Linked to this, it can also mean <vocabulary>integration</vocabulary>, because integration is easier if there's consistency, after all.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
